DataElement.preferredName: Protocol Agent Prior Hypersensitivity Yes No Indicator
DataElement.preferredDefinition: The yes/no indicator relating to an existing hypersensitivity, a local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized, to a therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

DataElementConcept.preferredDefinition: information relating to an existing hypersensitivity, a local or general reaction of an organism following contact with a specific allergen to which it has been previously exposed and to which it has become sensitized, to a therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

ObjectClass.preferredDefinition: A therapeutic agent (drug, intervention therapy) used in a clinical trial protocol.

Concepts.definition: A medical product, practice, or application that is tested in a clinical trial.

Property.preferredDefinition: Earlier in time or order.:Altered reactivity to an antigen, which can result in pathologic reactions upon subsequent exposure to that particular antigen.

Concepts.definition: An immune response that occurs following exposure to an innocuous antigen, but that does not require the presence of preformed antibodies to the antigen.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: evaluations of the patient and the patient's disease.

ValueDomain.preferredDefinition: The preferred Value Domain to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no.

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The non-affirmative response to a question.

ValueMeaning.administrativeNotes: 2022.12.28 Alt VM added per ticket request CADSR0001837. aj

ValueMeaning.preferredDefinition: The affirmative response to a question.

Concepts.definition: The affirmative response to a question.

ConceptualDomain.preferredDefinition: Conceptual domain that includes value meanings to be used for Indicator Value Meanings such as Yes, No, Unknown, No Applicable

RepresentationTerm.preferredDefinition: A caDSR representation term that is used to indicate a question with permissible values of yes/no

Concepts.definition: A response or indicator that can have a value of either yes or no.

RepresentationTerm.changeDescription: 10.3.20 TL changed WFS from RETIRED PHASED OUT to RETIRED ARCHIVED. Changed Workflow Status DBW 04-27-2016

ValueDomain.changeDescription: 8/29/17 tt added CSI per Round 5 finalization task. 3/12/17 jk added Standard reg status; ownership transfered from CTEP to NCI Standards with concurrence of CTEP/Brian Campbell. jk

ReferenceDocuments.name: Does the patient have a histo
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to agents used in study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: NRG_CRF Text
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to ipilmumab or other agents used in study?

ReferenceDocuments.name: ABTC 1302
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does the patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition to lapatinib?

ReferenceDocuments.name: COG_CRF_TEXT_1
ReferenceDocuments.description: Does patient have a history of allergic reactions attributed to compounds of similar chemical or biologic composition as the study agent?

DataElement.changeDescription: 03-09-2018 Removed space at end of Question Text. DW
